profile.name: Oussama Sghaier
profile.tagline: Researcher in Computer Vision & Autonomous Systems
affiliations: Robotics & Computer Vision Lab, University of Toulouse
profile.about: I am a researcher focusing on perception algorithms for autonomous aerial vehicles. My work spans 3D reconstruction, scene understanding, and collaborative robotics with an emphasis on real-world deployment.

researchFocus.title: Aerial Perception
researchFocus.description: Developing robust perception pipelines for autonomous drones operating in cluttered environments using multi-modal sensing.

researchFocus.title: Collaborative Robotics
researchFocus.description: Designing algorithms that enable seamless human-robot teaming for infrastructure inspection and disaster response.

researchFocus.title: 3D Reconstruction
researchFocus.description: Building scalable 3D reconstruction systems that combine classical geometry with modern deep learning representations.

spotlight.title: Spotlight
spotlight.description: Our recent paper on self-supervised scene completion for aerial robots received the Best Paper Award at ICRA 2024.

news.detail: Presented our work on self-supervised scene completion at ICRA 2024 in Yokohama, Japan.
Started a research residency at INRIA Sophia Antipolis focusing on collaborative perception.
Organized the workshop on Aerial Robots for Inspection at IROS 2023.

projects.name: SceneForge
projects.summary: A self-supervised framework that fuses LiDAR and RGB data to complete complex outdoor scenes in real-time.

projects.name: AeroTwin
projects.summary: A drone-based digital twin system for large-scale infrastructure inspection with adaptive path planning.

publications.title: Self-Supervised Scene Completion for Aerial Robots
publications.venue: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
